## Skill, Fees, and Equilibrium AUM 

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| results: asis
library(webexercises)

set.seed(NULL)
cap_skill   <- round(runif(1, 300, 800), 0)      # capacity with skill (in $ millions)
alpha_skill <- round(runif(1, 0.012, 0.03), 3)   # skill alpha up to capacity (decimal)
fee         <- round(runif(1, 0.005, 0.012), 3)  # fee on all AUM (decimal)

alpha_dollars <- cap_skill * 1e6 * alpha_skill   # annual $ alpha at capacity
# Equilibrium: investors add AUM X until net alpha = 0 -> alpha_dollars = fee * X
AUM_eq        <- alpha_dollars / fee
fees_dollars  <- AUM_eq * fee

alpha_skill_pct <- round(100*alpha_skill, 2)
fee_pct         <- round(100*fee, 2)
AUM_eq_m        <- round(AUM_eq/1e6, 0)
fees_m          <- round(fees_dollars/1e6, 2)
```

A manager can generate **α = `r alpha_skill_pct`%** per year up to **$`r cap_skill`m** of capital; above that, incremental α ≈ 0.  
The fund charges **`r fee_pct`%** on total AUM. Assume investors flock in until **net α = 0**.

✅ <strong>Equilibrium AUM</strong><br>
Dollar alpha at capacity: α × capacity = `r alpha_skill_pct`% × $`r cap_skill`m = 
<strong>$`r round(alpha_dollars/1e6,2)`m</strong> per year.<br>
At equilibrium, investors add capital until **dollar α = fees**:<br>
fee × AUM = `r fee_pct`% × AUM = $`r round(alpha_dollars/1e6,2)`m ⇒ 
AUM = $`r AUM_eq_m`m (rounded).
</div>

✅ <strong>Fee revenue at equilibrium</strong><br>
Fee revenue = fee × AUM = `r fee_pct`% × $`r AUM_eq_m`m = 
<strong>$`r fees_m`m</strong> per year.<br>
Notice this equals the manager’s **dollar α at capacity**: $`r round(alpha_dollars/1e6,2)`m.  
Intuition: competition drives **net α to investors ≈ 0**; skilled managers capture the rents via fees.
</div>
